Mr. Prank E. Schooley, Executive Secretary
The National Assn, of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
Urband, II1inois
My dear Frank:
Regarding the June 3rd Executive
Committee vote, I'd rather go on record as not
having voted. I v/ould he jjerfectly satisfied to
vote in the affirmative in spite of the Slowie letter,
hut since I, myself, am involved, I don't feel my
vote should determine the issue.
In any event, I am agreeable to
carrying out my promise, if that is the wish of
the group.
MSN:sd
NEW YORK
WORLD’S FAIR 1940
'New York City’s Own Station”—810 Kc.
